summary: The Critical Access for Veterans Care Act (S. 1868) aims to expand veterans' access to healthcare by amending Title 38 of the United States Code. It focuses on allowing veterans to utilize critical access hospitals and affiliated rural health clinics under the Veterans Community Care Program. Key provisions include expanding eligibility based on proximity to these facilities, prohibiting prior authorization for services, modifying payment rates to align with Medicare standards, and requiring a report to Congress on implementation.
